content.title: SEAk Aware Analysis Workflow
content.subtitle: Leverage SEAk Aware tools for environmental integrated planning and debris risk assessment.
description: The SEAk Aware Analysis Workflow allows users to configure environmental zones, run integrated debris analyses, and generate insightful visualizations for informed decision-making.
Access this feature under More Options → SEAk Aware Configuration.
Here, you can:
- View all SEAk Aware layers
- Toggle layer visibility
- Apply zone filters (e.g., restriction or warning zones)
- Add descriptions and notes
- Define habitat selections and upload relevant datasets
- Save your configurations for reuse
1. Navigate to Analytics Tool → SEAk Aware Analysis.
2. Select the prediction layer.
3. Name your result and run the analysis.
The analysis provides multiple outputs to support planning and monitoring:
- Graphical Summaries: Highlight warnings and restriction zones
- Map Hotspots: Toggle debris and risk layers
- Inspect Tool: Click debris points for detailed metadata
- Line Graph & Attribute Table: Review attributes such as type, class, cost, and area
SEAk Aware also integrates proximity-based tools for deeper insights:
- Debris Near Infrastructure: Enter distance value and units to identify debris near roads, boat routes, and beach accesses.
- Debris in Critical Habitats: Enter distance value and units to identify debris close to community and critical habitats.
Cost-based charts can be visualized, and comprehensive reports can be downloaded by clicking on the Download Report button.
